text: Frontiersmen and frontierswomen are people living on the frontier between settled and unsettled lands. The frontier was a place between civilization and the unknown wilderness.Tim McNeese, American Frontier (St. Louis, Mo.: Milliken Publishing Co., 2002), p. 2 Frontiersmen often cleared the land, built shelters, raised children, and grew crops.Tim McNeese, American Frontier (St. Louis, Mo.: Milliken Publishing Co., 2002), p. 20 Hunting and animal trapping were prime sources of meat.John C. Weaver, Great Land Rush and the Making of the Modern World, 1650-1900 (Montreal, Quebec: McGill-Queen's University Press, 2003), p. 106 Animal furs and skins were made into clothing. Famous American frontiersmen include Davy Crockett, Daniel Boone, and Kit Carson.Objects of Special Devotion: Fetishism in Popular Culture, ed. Ray Broadus Browne (Bowling Green, Ohio: Bowling Green University Popular Press, 1982), p. 155 The United States, Canada, and Australia are countries In which frontiersmen and women have been found in large numbers. == References == Category:American frontiersmen and women
title: Frontiersman
